attributes.action: Ringfence Science & Research Funding After Brexit.
attributes.background: For centuries the UK has been a driving force in terms of Science and innovation and we believe that it would be best for us all if we guarantee jobs and funding for our science sector.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that it is essential that any money being lost from UK Science should be guaranteed by the government. 

We also believe that the UK should continue to contribute to international collaberations such as the European Space Agency and CERN.

We believe that education should be available to all at a cost that will not cause financial difficulties.

attributes.action: Ban Britain First and English Defence League as far right white nationalists
attributes.background: Britain First, The English Defence League, LionheartGB and The Knights Templar groups, are far right white nationalists groups. That act to deliberately stoke tensions between ethnic divides. They promote racial hatred and unrest and serve no place in a civilised society.

attributes.action: Pass a law preventing the resale of event tickets by any company or website
attributes.background: Too many websites and companies exist or promote the resale of event tickets for vastly more than the original face value. No entity should be allowed to purchase by any means any number of tickets if their sole intent is to profit by reselling at inflated prices. The law should protect face values.
attributes.additional_details: Even on the opening day of sale of tickets on sites like Stereoboard, Axn, ticketmaster  it's virtually impossible to find tickets at face value. Instead tickets are immediately sold out, but on the same opening day resell prices are always immediately available at x2, x3 and more than face value. This is outrageous and should be illegal. Only honest fans should be able to buy tickets and the resale should be strictly controlled to face value plus reasonable postage, like standard 1st class.

attributes.action: Public enquiry over the last decade regarding social service/cafcass failings
attributes.background:
The failings of both social services/cafcass
And reluctance to follow up on detrimental information their reluctance to participate this alienated parents and their dismissal of information
attributes.additional_details: Information can be supplied by various groups

attributes.action: Abolish Bedroom Tax on all Council Properties
attributes.background: This Bedroom Tax is affecting thousands of families all across the UK, when it was originally imposed there was a lot of debate to abolish it and yet this has not been done.
attributes.additional_details:
This affects everyone living in social housing; disabled, welfare recipients, and those who work. If you live in a council property and have any spare bedrooms, you will be forced to pay the tax whatever your personal situation may be; even if you have lived in that property for up to 22 years. 

The government has decided that:

* Any single person aged 16 or over needs their own bedroom.
* A couple need a bedroom.
* A child needs a bedroom BUT.....
* A boy and a girl are expected to share a bedroom if they are both under 10.
* 2 boys or 2 girls are expected to share if they are both under 16. See below for examples.
* Foster children are not taken into account 
* Children who stay with you part of the time aren’t taken into account.

attributes.action: Form all party commission into social care provision
attributes.background:
We ALL know social care is in crisis. We need a 'joined-up' approach to social care and health that is 
- realistic about both need and cost
- reduces the party political blame game
- thinks long-term
- recognises the urgency for radical reform

attributes.action: Stop HS2 and reprieve threatened communities in East/West Midlands and Yorkshire
attributes.background: Consider cheaper alternatives to HS2. For example; improve East/West links and invest in digital connectivity to serve the "Northern Powerhouse"; re-classify first-class carriages; research the "Metro" idea and re-schedule timetables to boost capacity; complete proposed electrification projects.

attributes.action: Abolish the Human Rights Act.
attributes.background: We believe that the Human Rights Act should be abolished.  For too long, it has been used as a criminals charter to escape justice and deportation by using the right to family life.  It is high time the Government acted and abolished this pernicious Act.

attributes.action: Keep our community hospital open
attributes.background: We desperately need this hospital in a town the size of Saltash . The poor transport links to Derriford and Liskeard will be a huge problem to those who need minor injury treatment .

attributes.action: Add gender-neutral name fields to the marriage certificate
attributes.background: This petition proposes that two gender-neutral name fields be added to  the marriage certificate, to replace the father-only field. This suggestion is to enable parity, irrespective of gender/sexual orientation.
attributes.additional_details: In answer to the previous petition that the mother's name be added to the marriage certificate, alongside the father's [https://www.change.org/p/mothers-names-should-be-on-marriage-certificates], the Home Office decided that it cannot agree to adding the mother's name, as that assumes couples have opposite-gender parents, and the idea is therefore exclusionary. Gender-neutral name fields is the obvious solution to this problem.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for event tickets to be sold at more than Face Value.
attributes.background: Over the past 15 - 20 years it has become almost impossible to buy an event ticket for Face Value, companies like Ticketmaster etc are ticket touts of the worse kind. Not only do they increase the cost of the ticket they also add extra's e.g. handling fee, transaction costs, delivery.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent example: GetMeIn a Ticketmaster company: 2 x £55 Robbie Williams Tickets. £97.90 each, plus £35.88 transaction fee. Total for two tickets £231.68 
THIS IS DAYLIGHT ROBBERY & SHOULD BE ILLEGAL
Surely the venue has agreed on the original ticket price and this price has been set to cover all costs and overheads, therefore who, in this particular case benefits from the extra £121.68
Sporting Events:  VIVAGO ar offering Six Nations Tickets for Wales v England £75 tickets for £190 each

attributes.action: Increase all workers in the U.K. annual leave entitlement to 14 weeks
attributes.background: In line with with governments white paper for leaving the EU on chart 7.1, U.K. and EU employment law, the workers holiday entitlement is labelled as 14 weeks per year. We would like to see this implemented. We would also like to see the minimum wage across all age groups raised to £10p/h

attributes.action: Emotional Assistance Pet Act Urgently Needed.
attributes.background:
To grant the right for people in rented accommodation, who are struggling with emotional distress, depression - to keep a pet regardless of any “No Pet Clause”.

[According to Mental Health Foundation research, major depression is thought to be the second leading cause of disability worldwide.]
attributes.additional_details: The highest rates of suicides are associated with depressive disorder. More than, 6,00 suicides occur in the UK and Ireland each year. Due to the housing crisis we become "generation rent". The Mental Health Foundation research confirms value of "pet therapy" in suicide prevention and treating depression leading to it. It is scientifically confirmed that human-animal emotional bonds are equal to mother-child one, that no one would dare to question.

attributes.action: More democracy at work: let workers elect representatives to company boards
attributes.background:
The Prime Minister announced her support for a change in company law to allow workers to elect representatives to sit on company boards.

But this welcome proposal for corporate governance reform has been watered down. 

This is unacceptable - democratic representation should not be voluntary.
attributes.additional_details:
“If I’m prime minister ... we’re going to have not just consumers represented on 
company boards, but workers as well.”  - Theresa May, 11th July 2016

Worker representation is not a replacement for existing agreements between companies and trade unions. Nor is it a means of reducing the independence unions.

The TUC has published a report on how the policy could be implemented: https://www.tuc.org.uk/economic-issues/corporate-governance/workplace-issues/all-aboard-making-worker-representation

attributes.action: Change the Postal Voting System
attributes.background:
The postal voting system is wide open to abuse
There have been numerous examples of postal voter fraud in our country.
We believe that postal votes should only be available to our Armed Forces, people who are ill or who are on holiday
Also make photo ID at polling stations mandatory

attributes.action: Impose Economic Sanctions on Turkey.
attributes.background: The Turkish state has one of the worst human rights records in modern history, they are also the largest sponsor of terrorism in Syria, using Refugees as a political tool to manipulate foreign police and purging all opponents. This is dangerous. We must impose sanctions to bring Erdogan to heel.

attributes.action: Ensure all premises offering Electric Vehicle Chargers enforce EV only parking.
attributes.background: All premises(e.g. Supermarkets)should be mandated to enforce EV only parking in the space next to an Electric Charger if offering this service.This simple move nationwide would masssively boost the uptake & use of EVs. Hence help reduce air pollution in UK cities and decrease CO2 emissions.
attributes.additional_details: EV drivers are regularly frustrated in using Chargers,being frequently blocked by Non-EV Internal Combustion Engine cars (colloquially referred to by EV community as being ICE'd).Although there has been an expansion in number chargers inU.K,to be more than a token gesture it must be coupled with restricting parking bays to EVs. There are multitudes of evidence if search social media for term "ICE'd", see example here.Best regards https://twitter.com/broccoliinmilk/status/818393145503260672

attributes.action: More real term funding for schools, based on a per pupil funding formula
attributes.background: The government is imposing real term funding cuts on schools by freezing per-pupil funding while inflation and cost of employer pension and national insurance contributions increase. This affects all schools and academies alike. Without further funding schools will lose £3bn in real terms by 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
Wirral UNISON and other school unions do not want children in this country to miss out on a decent education, supplied by dedicated teachers and support staff with sufficient resources.
Average primary school cut is £87,000 or £339 per pupil.
Average secondary cut is £405,000 or £477 per pupil.
Visit http://www.schoolcuts.org.uk/#/ for more information.
Early indications had shown Wirral losing £10,759,698, figures now show this to be £15,696,153. 
That is 421 teachers or 872 support staff !

attributes.action: Legalise the sale & use of cannabis for people over the age of 25
attributes.background: The only reason it's illegal in the UK is because the government says it's bad for your health. They don't seem to mind that drinking & smoking is bad for your health & can actually kill you, unlike cannabis. There is no reason why the government should intervene if over-25's choose to use cannabis.
attributes.additional_details: Studies have shown that continuous recreational use of cannabis coincides with a slight gradual lack of IQ development but only up to the age of 25. Clinical scientific research has also shown conclusively that cannabis has a wide range of health benefits including the ability of the THC molecule to kill some cancers while leaving normal healthy cells unharmed. Criminalising the cure for cancer amounts to genocide. Experienced users know how to use it safely. The government should just back off.

attributes.action: Allow people who need IVF to have babies to have 2 live births through the NHS.
attributes.background: At the moment you can only have one live baby through the NHS with their IVF scheme. This is a petition to allow people who need IVF treatment to have at least two live babies with NHS funding. Both tries should allow two fresh and two frozen cycles.
attributes.additional_details: Currently you are only allowed two fresh and two frozen tries to conceive a baby. If you fall pregnant on these tries you are no longer allowed to have NHS funding for future babies. On average private IVF treatment costs around £8,000 for one attempt. Although it is fantastic to have one child most parents want their children to have a sibling and this should be on the NHS with funding from them too.

attributes.action: Make MPs resign if they oppose the will of the majority of their constituents.
attributes.background: The British people vote for their preferred members of parliament every five years. During the five year period of government the average British citizen has little influence over decisions and actions of the government of the day.
attributes.additional_details:
This is not so with those of us who are rich and powerful. These people have the means to influence government decisions through lobbying and legal challenge, both not readily available to the general public.
These methods of changing government actions are a challenge to the democratic processes of a nation and introduce inequality into a democratic society. To meet that challenge and rebalance democracy  this petition asks parliament to introduce a bill that holds members of parliament to immediately resign from office if they are found to be opposing the will of the majority of the constituents they represent."

attributes.action: Stop the Government sending £1.3 billion in foreign aid to China.
attributes.background: The Government plan to send £1.3 billion in foreign aid to help China's elderly is immoral when our own Social Care sector is failing. This money should be redirected into our own country.

attributes.action: Elevate the Cotswolds area of outstanding natural beauty to national park status
attributes.background: The Cotswolds is already an area of outstanding natural beauty, but continues to be accosted by unsuitable development. By elevating it to become a national park, increased protections in planning law will defend its beauty for generations to come and provide a much needed Midlands national park.

attributes.action: Stop all Funding to the EU
attributes.background: After the referendum result to leave the EU the UK will no longer be involved in decision Making within the EU as such all funding of the EU should cease

attributes.action: Private companies doing work for the NHS should display their logos on site.
attributes.background: Much of the NHS's work is done using private companies under the NHS logo.  It would inspire confidence in patients and their families and show responsibility if these companies were required to show their logos alongside that of the NHS in departments where their services are used.

attributes.action: Decisions must be issued within 6 months after asylum is claimed
attributes.background:
We deplore the fact that the Home Office is failing to issue decisions about the future of asylum seekers in a timely manner. 
It is clear that many clients are waiting over a year, which contravenes EU guidelines and poses a breach of their human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask the Home Office to obey their own guidelines which state that a decision will be made within 6 months after an asylum claim is made, and not the years many are experiencing today.
These people have fled to this country for political or religious reasons and are desperate to work, study and find their own home. They are prevented from doing this while waiting long overdue decisions by the Home Office. 
As a direct result, many suffer from mental health issues including stress, depression, sleeplessness, anxiety and physical problems. 
We therefore call on the Home Office to do everything in their power to give decisions within six months and to issue regular reports on the proportion of cases in which this is achieved.

attributes.action: Provide and fund a home education for 16-19 yrs olds with chronic conditions
attributes.background: The age of participation is 18 but for those with chronic conditions such as PoTS, CFS/ME, EDS there is no funding for home tution. If they fail their GCSEs they are unable to retake, there is not the provision to do A Levels at home. Few have an EHCP as it is considered health not education.
attributes.additional_details:
In a letter from Edward Timpson MP dated 5-11-15, he states that section 68, Education & Skills Act 2008 requires local authorities to make available support that will encourage & assist the participation young people in education or training up to the age 19. 
Without an EHCP there is no transition into post 16 education, LEAs are not made accountable for those unable to attend education or work as an apprentice. LEAs must be held accountable to provide education and/or apprenticeship for all.

attributes.action: Enforce pet ownership licence for each animal owned and microchipping
attributes.background: There are too many animals being dumped, abandoned and stolen in the UK.  It is deeply upsetting to see horses dumped because they have been neglected, family dogs stolen for baiting in dog fights and the resulting injured dogs.  This can be controlled by enforcing animal owners to obtain a licence.
attributes.additional_details:
There is endless evidence from all the animal rescue charities. RSPCA and World Horse Welfare to name a couple.  The number of unwanted animals is increasing each year. Some control must be taken
I suggest a large fines for non licences or bin chipped animals and pets.  Any unlicensed or Unchipped should be removed into care for resale or rehoming. The fines will cover the cost of sending out enforcing officers and administrative costs.

attributes.action: Amend the recall of parliament act 2015 to allow the electorate to dismiss MPs
attributes.background:
Amend the recall of parliament act 2015 to allow for fresh elections when 40% of the last turnout at a constituency election signs a petition calling for that.

The British public demand the means to remove our MPs if they are not acting in the interest of the British people
attributes.additional_details:
For far too long, prospective members of parliament and political parties of all denominations, have lied to the British public in order to get elected. 

The only way to ensure that those elected to office, keep their word once chosen to speak for the people, is to give the public the right to sack their MPs or government in much the same way that you would sack a negligent or under performing employee.

Many MP's are openly disregarding the will of the people and should therefore be removed.

attributes.action: Stop foreign aid to other countries until after Brexit
attributes.background: We need to stop foreign aid until we have left the EU and have our spending and taxes balanced. Help British before giving our hard earned money away!

attributes.action: Negotiate for the option to Remain in a reformed European Union
attributes.background: As part of the Article 50 negotiations, or in parallel, the government should hold talks with the European Union to negotiate an option for the UK to remain in the EU based upon reforms that could be made within the EU. It prudent to explore new options in addition to those already on the table.
attributes.additional_details: The current plan of the government of an uncharted hard Brexit or to return to WTO rules severely restricts our options for the future of the country. In the 2-year period of Article 50 negotiations the negative impact may become clearer and the demographics of the UK electorate will change towards the younger voters who are more pro-Europe and public opinion may change. So, the government should keep on the table this remain option so that Parliament and the people have a more flexible choice.

attributes.action: Make equine strangles notifiable to DEFRA
attributes.background:
Strangles is a potential killer and spreads quickly if a bill was passed to make this notifiable and precautions taken it could be contained.
Government should make it notifiable and enforce fines and fixed penalties to those who refuse to abide by restrictions set in place by DEFRA.
attributes.additional_details:
Far too many equine communities try to hide the fact that an outbreak has occurred in doing so it risks the lives of any equine that is unlucky enough to be exposed. 
Our equines need protecting from the irresponsible people who are unable to be honest and knowingly risk the lives of equines with an illness that is able to be confined if the correct procedure is followed our government need to help ensure that is possible.

attributes.action: Introduce a 10-day guarantee for safer, simpler and faster pension switching
attributes.background:
Pension firms can legally hang on to our money for six months if we request to change provider. They do it to earn more fees and often use delay tactics to deter us from switching. Consumers deserve better. 

Let's get a 10-day pension switch guarantee so we can take back control of our money.
attributes.additional_details:
We deserve the right to move our defined contribution pension pots safely and easily between providers. 

Pension firms that try to stop us from switching are preventing us from taking advantage of better and cheaper pension products. They are also exposing us to risks and scams. 

A 10-day pension switch guarantee would require providers to respect our choice to switch quickly and safely. 

Pensions are our money - we should be in control.

attributes.action: To grant leave to remain in the UK for my wife whom I'm married for 26 years.
attributes.background: I married to my wife a Singapore citizen for 26 years and have two children born in the UK and I am a UK citizen, we submitted many application over 18 years for Visa for my wife to remain in the UK but all was rejected(6 in all)After many tries and different forms the application is rejected again.
attributes.additional_details: I have medical problems and had two operations in 3 months and need someone to look after me and also suffering from depression.I have wasted most of my savings paying for the applications and recent application had to be submitted with medical insurance and the price has gone up for new applications.My family life has been ruined because of this and my kids grew up not knowing their mother well.We have a grandchild who was born April of this year.We have a right to be together.

attributes.action: The BBC Charter to be changed to prevent the BBC from accepting EU funds.
attributes.background: The BBC is haemorrhaging support due to its continual and visible bias towards the EU.  It is obvious to a large number of the citizens of the UK that this bias is fuelled directly by grants and continuing subsidies from the EU.  This negates the principle of funded by the people for the people.
attributes.additional_details:
From several Newspapers in January 2017.  This from the Express.

The Beeb has raked in more than £300,000 worth of EU grants since the referendum alone, with the money being paid out for "research projects" carried out by BBC staff. 

 The BBC insisted the cash has "no influence" on the editorial content of its news programmes. 

The row blew up after it emerged that Brussels has agreed to hand £352,750 to the taxpayer-funded broadcaster for its role in a research project.

attributes.action: Create a benefit for bereaved parents.
attributes.background: Currently in the U.K. there is a pension and a one off payment of £2000 of your partner dies. Well what if your child dies? Benefits for bereaved parents would give them time to grieve after loss.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents should not be struggling to make ends meet and worrying about how to pay the mortgage after the death of a child. 
They should be given a minimum of 6 months paid leave if their child dies, to come to terms with their loss. This would create a better working environment in the long run and better mental health for the parent/s affected. Also aftercare counselling should be provided for them to aid them in their wellbeing.

attributes.action: Give our brave Police Officers free access to local or on site Gyms.
attributes.background: Police Officers are required to pass a fitness test every year and also when they apply to take on different roles such as Public Order Policing or firearms roles. We expect our Police to chase people and climb fences. Most importantly we expect them to CATCH the suspects.
attributes.additional_details: Many Police Station based gyms have been closed and cops starting on £19'000 a year are paying over £60 per month in certain areas to keep themselves at the REQUIRED standard. If there is a required standard then surely they should be helped along. We want Gyms back in Police Stations or subsidised Gym memberships for our dedicated and professional Officers.

attributes.action: Guarantee that support for mental health patients continues when moving home
attributes.background: I am a MH patient and received great support when living in Corby. Fantastic Drs who were always hands on and regularly seeing a psychiatrist. I moved to London November 2016 and trying to find support has been horrendous. Support should never stop unless your psychiatrist signs you off.
attributes.additional_details: Mental health patients should not be ignored and this is something I am very passionate about. This is an illness that is not often visible and can often be neglected. I am starting this petition to guarantee all mental health patients receive the on going care they require and deserve. Neglecting a MH patient will only cause their illness to deteriorate.

attributes.action: Ban the use of wild animals in circuses in the U.K.
attributes.background:
In 2012 the Government made a commitment to ban the use of wild animals in travelling circuses before the end of 2015, it is now 2017 and there is still no ban.
With 94.5% of the public wanting to see this practice relegated to the history books, is it not time the U.K. followed suit?
attributes.additional_details:
Reasons why a ban is needed :
Wild animals do not jump through rings of fire, balance on balls or stand on their front legs voluntarily.
Circuses travel nearly all year round so the complex needs of wild animals can never be adequately met. 
Many undercover investigations have revealed evidence of circuses mistreating their animals.

attributes.action: Give an extra £350M each week to the NHS on the same day as serving Article 50.
attributes.background: This was a significant promise made during the referendum, and should be delivered.

attributes.action: Stop the the imposition of business rates on solar panels
attributes.background:
the recent reductions in tariff incentives for solar and other renewables has greatly reduced the ability of people to fund renewables  
the imposition of business rates on solar in particular will make many schemes uneconomic and result in them being removed
attributes.additional_details: the business community is putting together a letter to the chancellor spelling out the underdesirable affects of this tax rise

attributes.action: Get the M.o.D. to agree to a last minute bid to purchase the ex-HMS Illustrious
attributes.background: There is a new consortium currently negotiating with the M.o.D. with respect to purchasing the ex-Royal Navy Aircraft Carrier HMS Illustrious, which if allowed to proceed, would save her from the scrapyard and instead see her preserved as a heritage attraction for the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The funds necessary to cover all aspects of the purchase are in place, thus all that is required is for the M.o.D. to agree, and this iconic ship - the last surviving Invincible Class Aircraft Carrier, can be secured as an asset for the nation, for present and future generations to visit. Despite having received several high value heritage bids, the MoD instead agreed a much lower value scrap deal, clearly not the best financial option for the taxpayer. She is still en route under tow to Turkey.

attributes.action: Provide West Sussex schools with interim funding until new funding is in place.
attributes.background: Schools in West Sussex receive considerably less funding than other areas of the country to educate children. (Approx £200 per pupil) This will potentially result in schools reducing teaching to 4 days a week until a new funding formula is implemented due to such shortages in current school budgets.
attributes.additional_details: For more information see the Worthless campaign details.

attributes.action: Request the Home Office to remove "Place of birth" from British passports
attributes.background: Following recent US/Trump policy to ban Muslims/individuals, many British citizens will be affected adversely due to their place of birth as they face various complications. This is a violation of human rights & an act of discrimination when 2 citizens of same country are treated differently.
attributes.additional_details:
Travelers seeking to enter the United States for business or tourism or in transit for less than 90 days may be eligible to travel to the United States visa free under the Visa Waiver Program if they meet specific requirements. This will affect those British citizens whose place of birth is one of those listed countries (e.g. high visa cost, length visa processing, potential of being treated differently by officials once in the US, etc.) 
https://uk.usembassy.gov/visas/visa-waiver-pro

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Nye Bevan in the Houses of Parliament celebrating the NHS.
attributes.background: The founder of the greatest achievment this country has witnessed should be recognised, by a statue in the houses of parliament.

attributes.action: Open an enquiry into the abuse of psychoactive substances (NPS) within prison
attributes.background: The growing use of new and largely non-detectable psychoactive substances (NPS) is leading to increased violence, bullying, debt and medical emergencies requiring hospitalisation. We demand a thorough enquiry immediately to investigate the claims made in the Secret Lives of Prisons Documentary
attributes.additional_details:
People in prison, prisoners and staff, are
less safe than they were five years ago. This year more
prisoners were murdered, killed themselves, self harmed
and were assaulted than ever before
Serious assaults in prison have more than
doubled in the last three years. 
Rates of self-harm are at the highest level ever
recorded. There were 32,313 self-harm incidents in
2015—a nearly 40% rise in just two years.
We believe this is a direct result of overcrowding and  NPS. We demand an immediate enquiry

attributes.action: Prevent councils from moving homeless people into other areas without permission
attributes.background:
Private companies are buying up housing stock, evicting the tenants, then offering the properties to the local council as temporary accommodation for the homeless.

If the council says "no," the firm offers the properties to another local authority to move their homeless people into.
attributes.additional_details:
In Peterborough, a private firm evicted tenants and their families from 74 homes on a single estate then offered the properties to Peterborough City Council as temporary accommodation.

The firm told the council that if it did not take up the properties, they would be used by a London borough for its homeless people.

This practice is going on around the country and is causing misery for many people. 

See:

http://tinyurl.com/zf9atnv

http://tinyurl.com/zsyc6x6

http://tinyurl.com/hro3dqp

attributes.action: Ensure that the triple lock on the Basic State Pension is retained
attributes.background:
The government is considering ending this
The triple lock is a guarantee to increase the state pension every year by the higher of inflation, average earnings or a minimum of 2.5%.
This is essential to ensure the poorest of retired people can manage in winter

attributes.action: I want to see a mandatory Driving ban for using a mobile device when driving.
attributes.background: People are being killed on the roads in the UK due to irresponsible motorists using mobile devices whilst driving. The law should be changed to ensure that any motorist using a mobile device whilst driving should receive an automatic driving disqualification of 6 months for a first time offence.
attributes.additional_details: A driver who recently killed three children and a woman whilst he was distracted whilst using his mobile device received a ten year custodial sentence. He had previously been warned about using a mobile device whilst driving by his employers yet he still continued to flout the law.

attributes.action: Require all Chancellors of the Exchequer to publish their annual tax returns.
attributes.background: The Chancellor of the Exchequer is the government’s chief financial minister and as such is responsible for raising revenue through taxation. As a sign of openness, and accountability to the tax payer, the current and future Chancellors must publicly prove the integrity of their own tax affairs.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been a number of high profile examples of companies, and celebrities, that have managed to pay very little tax despite having incomes that few of us could realistically hope to achieve. Even though this is currently legal, the last Prime Minister described this as "morally wrong". 

It should be the case that anyone holding the position of Chancellor of the Exchequer publicly shows that they possess high moral standards when it comes to their own tax affairs. 

Thank you.
